Title: Series: The Amarna Letters
Description: Clay cuneiform tablet; Akkadian literary; the myth of Nergal and Ereshkigal; 40 lines; top half of tablet only; the other half of the tablet is in Berlin (VAT 1611+)
Bibliographic references: Knudtzon, J A 1915a / Die El-Amarna Tafeln (357)
Bezold 1892a / The El-Amarna Tablets in the British Museum (82)
Izre'el, CM 9 / The Amarna scholarly tablets (pages 51-61 and pls XXIII-XXX)
Pritchard 1950a / Ancient Near Eastern Texts relating to the Old Testament (pages 103-104)
Leichty E et al 1988a / Catalogue of the Babylonian Tablets in the British Museum, volume VIII: Tablets from Sippar 3 (p.176)
Sigrist M et al 2006a / Catalogue of the Babylonian Tablets in the British Museum, III
Condition: Incomplete; bottom half lost; existing writing on obverse nearly worn away.
Acquisition name: From: Sir Ernest A T Wallis Budge
